meanings.definition: To bet more money than is necessary or prudent in a gambling game.
meanings.sent1: He tends to overbet when he's feeling lucky at the poker table.
meanings.sent2: She realized she had overbet her entire savings on a single hand of blackjack.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel overbet all his acorns on a game of cards and lost them all.
meanings.sent4: The student overbet his time studying for one subject and neglected the others.
meanings.sent5: The chef overbet on the spiciness of the dish, making it too hot for most customers.

meanings.definition: An excessive or imprudent bet in a gambling game.
meanings.sent1: The overbet he placed on the horse race was risky but potentially rewarding.
meanings.sent2: The gambler regretted making such a large overbet on a hand that was not in his favor.
meanings.sent3: The overbet on the roulette wheel made the other players gasp in surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her overbet on the final round of the tournament showed her confidence in her hand.
meanings.sent5: The overbet on the lottery ticket turned out to be a lucky decision, winning him a huge prize.
